i5.las2peer.services.servicePackage

Class ServiceClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • i5.las2peer.api.Configurable
      • i5.las2peer.api.Service
        • i5.las2peer.services.servicePackage.ServiceClass

  • public class ServiceClass
extends i5.las2peer.api.Service
    LAS2peer Service This is a template for a very basic LAS2peer service that uses the LAS2peer Web-Connector for RESTful access to it.

    • Method Detail

      • validateLogin

        public i5.las2peer.restMapper.HttpResponse validateLogin()
        Simple function to validate a user login. Basically it only serves as a "calling point" and does not really validate a user (since this is done previously by LAS2peer itself, the user does not reach this method if he or she is not authenticated).

      • exampleMethod

        public i5.las2peer.restMapper.HttpResponse exampleMethod(java.lang.String myInput)
        Another example method.
        Parameters:
        myInput -

      • getUserEmail

        public i5.las2peer.restMapper.HttpResponse getUserEmail(java.lang.String username)
        Example method that shows how to retrieve a user email address from a database and return an HTTP response including a JSON object. WARNING: THIS METHOD IS ONLY FOR DEMONSTRATIONAL PURPOSES!!! IT WILL REQUIRE RESPECTIVE DATABASE TABLES IN THE BACKEND, WHICH DON'T EXIST IN THE TEMPLATE.

      • setUserEmail

        public i5.las2peer.restMapper.HttpResponse setUserEmail(java.lang.String username,
                                               java.lang.String email)
        Example method that shows how to change a user email address in a database. WARNING: THIS METHOD IS ONLY FOR DEMONSTRATIONAL PURPOSES!!! IT WILL REQUIRE RESPECTIVE DATABASE TABLES IN THE BACKEND, WHICH DON'T EXIST IN THE TEMPLATE.

      • debugMapping

        public boolean debugMapping()
        Method for debugging purposes. Here the concept of restMapping validation is shown. It is important to check, if all annotations are correct and consistent. Otherwise the service will not be accessible by the WebConnector. Best to do it in the unit tests. To avoid being overlooked/ignored the method is implemented here and not in the test section.
        Returns:
        true, if mapping correct

      • getRESTMapping

        public java.lang.String getRESTMapping()
        This method is needed for every RESTful application in LAS2peer. There is no need to change!
        Returns:
        the mapping
